page.title: 03INVERNAVER NATURE RESERVE 2
page.content: {Plants}Mountain Avens, Purple Saxifrage, Yellow Mountain Saxifrage, Scottish Primrose, Purple Oxytropis, Baltic Rush, Curved Sedge, Juniper, Frog Orchid, Dark Red Helleborine, Felwort. {Animals}Sheep, cattle and rabbits graze on the Reserve, so most of the plants are eaten to a low height. Red Deer, Foxes, Otters and Mountain Hare can also be found there. Wildcats are rarely encountered. {Birds}Raven, Mallard, Ringed Plover, Common Sandpiper, Oystercatcher, Ring Ouzel and Twite nest regularly on the Reserve. A variety of duck and geese visit the estuaries in winter. {Archaeology }An Iron Age Fort called a Broch. An Iron Age settlement of Hut Circles, stone graves called cists.A battle site called Creag-Druim-Doun.
